component.name: elasticsearch
component.title: Elasticsearch
component.description: Send requests to ElasticSearch via Java Client API.
component.label: search,monitoring

connectionTimeout.description: The time in ms to wait before connection will timeout.

enableDocumentOnlyMode.description: Indicates whether the body of the message contains only documents. By default, it is set to false to be able to do the same requests as what the Document API supports (see https://www.elastic.co/guide/en/elasticsearch/reference/current/docs.html for more details). To ease the migration of routes based on the legacy component camel-elasticsearch-rest, you should consider enabling the mode especially if your routes do update operations.

hostAddresses.description: Comma separated list with ip:port formatted remote transport addresses to use. The ip and port options must be left blank for hostAddresses to be considered instead.

lazyStartProducer.label: producer
lazyStartProducer.description: Whether the producer should be started lazy (on the first message). By starting lazy you can use this to allow CamelContext and routes to startup in situations where a producer may otherwise fail during starting and cause the route to fail being started. By deferring this startup to be lazy then the startup failure can be handled during routing messages via Camel's routing error handlers. Beware that when the first message is processed then creating and starting the producer may take a little time and prolong the total processing time of the processing.

maxRetryTimeout.description: The time in ms before retry

socketTimeout.description: The timeout in ms to wait before the socket will timeout.

autowiredEnabled.label: advanced
autowiredEnabled.description: Whether autowiring is enabled. This is used for automatic autowiring options (the option must be marked as autowired) by looking up in the registry to find if there is a single instance of matching type, which then gets configured on the component. This can be used for automatic configuring JDBC data sources, JMS connection factories, AWS Clients, etc.

client.label: advanced
client.description: To use an existing configured Elasticsearch client, instead of creating a client per endpoint. This allow to customize the client with specific settings.

enableSniffer.label: advanced
enableSniffer.description: Enable automatically discover nodes from a running Elasticsearch cluster. If this option is used in conjunction with Spring Boot then it's managed by the Spring Boot configuration (see: Disable Sniffer in Spring Boot).

sniffAfterFailureDelay.label: advanced
sniffAfterFailureDelay.description: The delay of a sniff execution scheduled after a failure (in milliseconds)

snifferInterval.label: advanced
snifferInterval.description: The interval between consecutive ordinary sniff executions in milliseconds. Will be honoured when sniffOnFailure is disabled or when there are no failures between consecutive sniff executions

certificatePath.label: security
certificatePath.description: The path of the self-signed certificate to use to access to Elasticsearch.

indexId.description: The id of the indexed document.

indexName.description: The name of the index to act against

documentClass.description: The full qualified name of the class of the document to unmarshall

waitForActiveShards.description: The index creation waits for the write consistency number of shards to be available

scrollKeepAliveMs.description: The starting index of the response.

useScroll.description: Set to true to enable scroll usage

from.description: The starting index of the response.
